definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: Such youth and prettiness reacted upon him more subtly than wine.
sentences.chinese: 如此青春的美色，比醇酒更令他沉醉入迷。

sentences.english: Spies use sex, intelligence, and the thrill of a secret life as bait.
sentences.chinese: 間諜運用美色與智慧，周旋其中，擔當魚餌。

sentences.english: If you could not control yourself, you could be tempted by money and sex.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不控制自己，金錢美色，什麼都會送上來。

sentences.english: In front of her, hold the moral bottom line, is the minimum life part.
sentences.chinese: 在美色面前，守住道德底線，是做人的起碼本分。

sentences.english: Fu hit a peak during the period from the Han Dynasty to the Bei Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 漢魏六朝是美色賦發展的高峯時期。

sentences.english: I stick to my professional virtues, and will never be allured by beautiful women.
sentences.chinese: 我堅持自己的職業操守，絕不會爲美色所誘惑。

sentences.english: Tan sacred beauty, blunt the sharp'st intents.
sentences.chinese: 曬黑美色，並挫鈍鋒銳的企圖。

sentences.english: Beauty is only skin deep, and somebody peeled her.
sentences.chinese: 美色只是一層皮，而有人扒了她的皮。

sentences.english: He's tyrannical, he's rapacious, he's undisciplined, he's over-sexed.
sentences.chinese: 殘暴，貪婪，毫無修養，沉溺美色。

sentences.english: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
sentences.chinese: 你心中不要戀慕他的美色，也不要被他眼皮勾引。

definition: (of greed, lust etc) to dominate one's thoughts
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
greedy for sex/given to lust for women
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
